title: Business news live: Latest Brexit and finance news as pound sterling value slumps
text:
The government has unveiled plans to cut tariffs on most goods entering the UK to mitigate the risk of a recession after a no-deal Brexit.

Following lobbying from industries expected to be hit hard by a disorderly departure from the EU, the government made some changes to the regime proposed last March.

Meanwhile, the pound has slumped to a three-week low against the dollar as hopes fade that a Brexit deal will be reached before a crunch EU summit next week.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.
